abstract: Prosecutors in trial of New York State Sen John L Sampson present wiretapped conversation in which Sampson urges friend Edul Ahmad, who was cooperating with government, to hide check register documenting improper payments; Sampson has been charged in Federal District Court in Brooklyn with witness tampering and other offenses after judge dropped two previous charges of embezzlement of state funds.
lead_paragraph: In a wiretapped conversation with a friend, State Sen. John L. Sampson, a Democrat from Canarsie, called a check register a “problem” and urged his friend to say nothing about it to investigators.

headline.main: Brooklyn Senator Told Friend Not to Show Check Register to Investigators
headline.print_headline: Don’t Show Check Register to Investigators, Brooklyn Senator Told Friend

snippet: In a wiretapped conversation with a friend, State Sen. John L. Sampson, a Democrat from Canarsie, called a check register a “problem” and urged his friend to say nothing about it to investigators.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
